channel.title: Disabling Graphics?
channel.description:
Hello there. I have been working on a bot called JIF. My name on other forums is illusion but i registered along time ago with this name and haven't been bothered to re-register anyways i have the following code to disable graphics and it seems to not be working if anyone could help me, it would be really appreciated.
[code] CanvasHack = (org.jif.hooks.Canvas) getClient(); CanvasHack.setEnabled(!CanvasHack.isGraphicsEnabled());[/code]
Were getClient() is my client hook and CanvasHack is my Canvas hook
Thanks!

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Euler angles

The Euler angles are three angles introduced by Leonhard Euler to describe the orientation of a rigid body with respect to a fixed coordinate system. They can also represent the orientation of a mobile frame of reference in physics or the orientation of a general basis in 3-dimensional linear algebra. Any orientation can be achieved by composing three elemental rotations, i.e. rotations about the axes of a coordinate system. Euler angles can be defined by three of these rotations. They can also ...


Oh God. What the hell is wrong with normal angles.

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:56, topic:167202”]You take the 3D points in the model file, take the position of the camera, and apply a rotation matrix. Then project the matrices into 2D polygons.[/quote]that is one method, jagex use euler angles, though

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

The 3D math isn’t too complicated, at least from my limited experience with 3D rendering, but wL doubtless understands it better than I do.
You take the 3D points in the model file, take the position of the camera, and apply a rotation matrix. Then project the matrices into 2D polygons.
I know of a funeral home that needs a eulogy writer

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

They use light zelix obfuscation and either use soot or something they wrote after studying soot as there are transformations applied to the code that are not found in zelix but sound suspiciously like those found in the paper written by one of the students involved in the primary work of soot.
ex: I have not found any option for zelix to mangle method signatures. I also have a strong feeling that their static field/method transforms (contextual location mangling) is custom.

qauters: Create something simple and run it through zelix under aggressive with or without string encryption. Take what you get and decompile it. After doing so, I have a feeling you will wish to correct your comment. Aggressive flow transformations imposed by zelix are fairly devastating. I have only toyed with it in passing but it was enough to turn me away unless I really wanted to get to the source.

krich: I’ve seen only one completely deobfuscated/renamed runescape 3d renderer; wL did it. Not that my word carries any weight, but after looking at all of wL’s source, I am constrained to say that he is by far and away the top of any list of any rogue rs developer. He has done more with their client than anyone. I thought I did some interesting things… his deep understanding of the underlying math involved with 3d transformations is clear with his renamed client.

Didn’t mean to make that sound like a eulogy…

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:53, topic:167202”][quote author=sh!ft link=topic=226584.msg1955871#msg1955871 date=1198757788]
Which leads me to infer that the Jagex engine, is far far better than the end client we see. I’m of the opinion that the obfuscation massacres the efficiency and capabillity.
[/quote]

I’ve heard different things - some claim that obfuscation improves performance by using bytecode-valid but non-decompiling optimizations and such. But I’ve also seen (and this seems right to me) that by its very nature introducing unnecessary variables and branching murders performance. I’ve never seen or used any other homebrew Java 3D engine, nor the RuneScape one without obfuscation, so I have no way to know for sure. I wonder if there have been any papers on it? It would be interesting to see some concrete numbers.[/quote]
According to Zelix the performance drop by 30%, when using their best protection. I think they use this, cause the easy protection hardly change anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy

@Krichevskoy wrote:

sh!ft:

Which leads me to infer that the Jagex engine, is far far better than the end client we see. I’m of the opinion that the obfuscation massacres the efficiency and capabillity.

I’ve heard different things - some claim that obfuscation improves performance by using bytecode-valid but non-decompiling optimizations and such. But I’ve also seen (and this seems right to me) that by its very nature introducing unnecessary variables and branching murders performance. I’ve never seen or used any other homebrew Java 3D engine, nor the RuneScape one without obfuscation, so I have no way to know for sure. I wonder if there have been any papers on it? It would be interesting to see some concrete numbers.

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

saying i never do anything is largely ignorant and childish, just because i dont make a lot of noise, doesnt mean i am not active in some way, i dont feel the need to post crap constantly in the pursuit of rep.

if you ask me for help, i will give it. unlike with most people, the information i will give will be accurate, i wont mislead you either, no matter whether i like you or not

i do not care if you like ruler over me, i dont give a damn about popularity

this is the exact attitude i dislike with the “cheating scene”, when something is released, if it isnt retard friendly, it goes ignored.

scar has reason to be hated, it is inefficient; you can only run one client at a time, its colour based, it relies on searching, it hijacks the user’s mouse, there are probably more reasons to hate it but i cant be bothered atm

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

why are you guys so gay against Ruler and Ollie, theres precious few knowledgeable people left, and I’d much rather talk to ruler then talk to the guy who made this thread, hey sometimes I’d choose ruler over frank_.

Why don’t we have some piece and love?

non of you people are perfect and nether am I, but I still put up with all of that and try to have a conversation.
Like I don’t like how frank_ always talks and talks and talks and never does anything.
and how Silver Lining seems very very lazy, “I’v been working on generibot for 10 years and I’v only got to put the last full stop, but I can’t be asked to do that!”

and both of you are so incredibly elitist, every time a very slightly un-knowledgeable person comes along, you both shit on him like a toilet, and you’re not the only ones.
I also don’t like frank_ cause he hates Scar but they We are doing much more autoing, are more organized, and generally nicer over there at Scar-dedicated forums.

^despite all this dislike, we still talk sometimes on IRC and stuff like that.

so Ollie has removed some @author tags from a project I’v never heard of, you think hes the only one? how many times I’v blatantly plagiarism all of your bots and clients, and when I make my own version, all I hear is “great job yakman, i wish i could do that”, well you can, you just need to plagiarise some more.

remember, in our communist times, all code is everyones property, when you release or send something, you feed it into the combined peer-to-peer machine that is rscheating, so have some consolation that ‘your’ code is being put to good use.
I don’t even know what ruler’s done, so it must have been long ago or un-interesting, so why don’t you just forget it and get along,

^I’m not saying Ollie and ruler are perfect either, like sometimes you can be talking to ruler and he suddenly goes very quiet, because you’ve insulted him by accident, then you have to change the subject to get back… its a real drag.

and what’s methscape?

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“speedster239, post:37, topic:167202”]^^It’s true, I wonder why they sacrifice the efficiency of their game when they know that the obfuscation isn’t doing much to us. Their are updaters that can sustain almost everything and I’m sure they could be built even more solid.

I wonder if Mechscape will be obfuscated, it seems like its going to be way more graphically intensive/require alot of CPU. Since it seems more like its going to be a fps or something alot of useless hacks like hp announcer in RS might be pretty useful for it, aka exposing camocoverd players etc.[/quote]

Of course it will be. Several of Gower’s later mini games were obfuscated, then RSC was obfuscated with that same obfuscation (lol). RS2 was obfuscated from the start, and there is no reason why MechScape will not be obfuscated.

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

Mm, to lower cpu cycles minimize the shifts, and crash the sound engine. These are both easily accomplished, the shifts are just like value &= Type.bitLength… And the sound engine? Inject a throws in the sound engine intializer. Once the midi mapper/synth is dead, along side the lack of necessity for it to optimize shifts in the runtime engine cuts cpu usage drasticly, way more than you’d think.

Which leads me to infer that the Jagex engine, is far far better than the end client we see. I’m of the opinion that the obfuscation massacres the efficiency and capabillity.

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

You don’t even need to write a hook to get the graphics component.
Assuming that the app is the Applet component in which runescape is just do:

Graphics g = app.getComponentAt(1,1).getGraphics();

//Do whatever you want with g, ie: g.fillRect(5,5,10,10);

If your writing a graphics system for your bot just put all of the paint methods in there own thread. Example, I put the paint-mouse in its own thread and the regular graphics paint in another thread. If I’m compltely off about what your even talking about than excuse me but you only posted two lines of code which had little relevance.

Read full topic
